content:
Have changed the settings in settings.py.
Do I need to restart the Zulip server?
If so, how?

Is that somewhere in the docs?
Cause I spent at least twenty minutes trying to RTFM, and am curious what else I missed

Hmm, it's mentioned a bunch across the various doc pages where it's needed to be used (https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/search.html?q=restart-server&check_keywords=yes&area=default), but perhaps we should bring it up more explitictly somewhere? Where have you looked that would have been a good place to mention it?

Firstly, I see that it was right in front of my nose, on the top of https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/stable/production/settings.html
However, I think it should be on
https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/stable/production/upgrade-or-modify.html
And IMO it should be more prominent on https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/stable/production/email.html
Where it should be part of the instructions (after change run...) instead of just part of the preamble.

Actually, that goes also for settings, it should reference the restart at the end of the page as well, but maybe I am just being overly noob.

And, perhaps it can be in https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/stable/production/management-commands.html
Since this is also a management command, and looking through the table of contents, I suspect many users would look there first.
And please, don't take this as criticism. I appreciate your time in chat, as well as dev etc time - just trying to think what would have helped me

We always appreciate feedback on improving documentation, especially since that's the best way to get it in a good shape - by having people use it and tell us how it could have been made more clear for them :slight_smile:
@Sam Goody thanks for the feedback! I've been thinking for a while we should have more canonical text around restarting the server, so it's great to hear that from a user as well.
